attributes.additional_details: What was Icke going to talk about on the 15th of November? Thanks to K. Green we will never know. So, I feel it is not unreasonable to ask K. Green to tell us how we are all better off not hearing someone speak freely. Ms Green has every right to put her fingers in her own ears and sing La La, but she has no right to put her fingers in other people's ears. Does K. Green plan to assume the role of a fireman from Bradbury's book, Fahrenheit 451?
attributes.background: On the 15th of Nov. 2017 in Manchester, MP Kate Green prevented David Icke from talking about his latest book, "Everything You Need to Know". A book that can be freely purchased and lodged with the British Library. Do we next see the burning of his books?

rejection.details: The decision to cancel this event was taken by Manchester United, not by the UK Government or Parliament.
